meanings.definition: In a way that causes something to be spread out or scattered.
meanings.sent1: The seeds were scattered dispersively by the wind.
meanings.sent2: The paint was applied dispersively across the canvas.
meanings.sent3: The magician dispersively made the cards disappear into thin air.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room dispersively, reaching every corner.
meanings.sent5: The bubbles rose dispersively in the fizzy drink, tickling her nose.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows a tendency to scatter or disperse.
meanings.sent1: The clouds moved dispersively across the sky.
meanings.sent2: The students spread out dispersively after the bell rang.
meanings.sent3: The kittens played dispersively, chasing each other around the room.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts wandered dispersively, unable to focus on one thing.
meanings.sent5: The leaves fell dispersively from the tree, creating a colorful carpet on the ground.
